intro: Ranunculus parnassifolius subsp. heterocarpus, commonly known as the Parnassian buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features delicate, yellow flowers with five to nine petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has palmately divided leaves that are hairy and often covered in fine, glandular dots. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique fruit structure, which is a compound follicle containing multiple seeds.
